title: Language-Integrated Project-Based Training Design for Team Sport Skill Acquisition

context.prior_knowledge: Possession of intermediate-level professional knowledge and problem-solving skills, understanding of basic sports terminology and collaborative language expressions
context.additional_context: Part of corporate youth language education programs, improving teamwork and communication skills (clear instruction, tactical discussion, feedback exchange) through team sports training. Emphasis on contextual language learning using real-game scenarios.

learning_goals: Learners will perform fundamental team sport skills (pass, dribble, defense) with 80% accuracy while correctly using related action directives (e.g., “pass,” “take defensive position”).
Learners will apply tactical judgments (offense/defense transitions) with over 70% accuracy in game situations and clearly communicate tactical instructions (e.g., “switch,” “cover”).

Learners will draft a one-page role-assignment plan in 4–5 member team projects and submit team project outcomes after achieving over 80% on a collaboration checklist (three items: communication clarity, responsibility fulfillment, contribution evaluation).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
